text: Percy Lavon Julian (April 11, 1899 â€“ April 19, 1975) was an American research chemist and a well known scientist in the chemical synthesis of medicinal drugs from plants. His works would lead to the invention of birth control pills. He was born in Montgomery, Alabama. Julian died in Waukegan, Illinois from liver cancer, aged 76. ==References== Category:1899 births Category:1975 deaths Category:American chemists Category:Cancer deaths in Illinois Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:People from Montgomery, Alabama
title: Percy Lavon Julian
